text.label: How to use the Viggen Autoflight System
The Viggen Auto Pilot has 3 modes:
STICK (SPAK): Series servo dampers engaged, as well as the series trim.
ATT (ATT): Pitch attitude and roll attitude (>= 7 deg) or heading (< 7 deg) is held.
ALT (HOJD): Current altitude is held. Roll is the same as ATT mode.
If the gear is in, current airspeed in KMH is held. It can be adjusted via CTRL+UP or CTRL+DN.
In speed mode, the A/T will turn off and won't engage if the speed is below 495KMH (267KTS.)
If the gear is out for 5 sec, alpha is held by adjusting thrust. Target is 9 deg to 12 deg based on weight.
High alpha mode changes the alpha target to 15 deg.
After autothrottle disengagement, the control lever must be switched OFF and ON again to re-engage.
